> I'm more worried about keeping sandboxes alive after recipe execution but while the add-on is loaded. It sounds like that is going to be required though, since the action is going to have a pretty active involvement in the experiment.

If we persist the watchers like we probably will be for the persistent timeouts (#591) then we don't need to maintain a sandbox. I think that might suffice for our needs here.

> Should we lower the 5 minute delay from startup, and instead delay heartbeats by 5 minutes? It sounds beneficial to have these experiments run sooner.

Hmmmm, I dunno. I'm going to bring up the issue of how accurate we need to be when marking experiment participation with the data team today. They might be able to deal with these issues on the analysis side.

I'm more worried about keeping sandboxes alive after recipe execution but while the add-on is loaded. It sounds like that is going to be required though, since the action is going to have a pretty active involvement in the experiment.

If we persist the watchers like we probably will be for the persistent timeouts (#591) then we don't need to maintain a sandbox. I think that might suffice for our needs here.

Should we lower the 5 minute delay from startup, and instead delay heartbeats by 5 minutes? It sounds beneficial to have these experiments run sooner.

Hmmmm, I dunno. I'm going to bring up the issue of how accurate we need to be when marking experiment participation with the data team today. They might be able to deal with these issues on the analysis side.
body_html:
I'm more worried about keeping sandboxes alive after recipe execution but while the add-on is loaded. It sounds like that is going to be required though, since the action is going to have a pretty active involvement in the experiment.

If we persist the watchers like we probably will be for the persistent timeouts (#591) then we don't need to maintain a sandbox. I think that might suffice for our needs here.

Should we lower the 5 minute delay from startup, and instead delay heartbeats by 5 minutes? It sounds beneficial to have these experiments run sooner.

Hmmmm, I dunno. I'm going to bring up the issue of how accurate we need to be when marking experiment participation with the data team today. They might be able to deal with these issues on the analysis side.
